rules.title: Official Rates & Rules You Should Know
points: Deposit window: ₹500 minimum to ₹1.5 lakh maximum per year.
Lock-in period: 15 years, extendable in 5-year blocks.
Partial withdrawals allowed from the 7th financial year; loans possible from the 3rd year.
rules.footer_note: Rates are verified quarterly by the Ministry of Finance, GoI. We automatically update the rate on this page.

faqs.question: What is the current PPF interest rate, and when was it last updated?
faqs.answer: The current interest is typically around 7.1%, set quarterly by the Government of India. This page shows the most recent rate and update date.

faqs.question: Can I deposit monthly or annually?
faqs.answer: Yes. Both options are supported by this calculator. Monthly deposits allow smaller savings throughout the year, while annual deposits let you invest a lump sum.

faqs.question: Deposits made after the 5th of the month — do they earn interest?
faqs.answer: No. Deposits must be made before the 5th to earn interest for that month. This detail can add substantial interest over time.

faqs.question: When can I withdraw from PPF?
faqs.answer: You can make a partial withdrawal after the 7th financial year. Complete withdrawals are allowed after maturity (15 years). Loans are available from the 3rd year.

faqs.question: Is the maturity amount from PPF tax-free?
faqs.answer: Yes. PPF offers EEE benefits — contributions (under ₹1.5 lakh), interest, and maturity amount are all exempt from tax.

faqs.question: Can NRIs invest in PPF?
faqs.answer: No. NRIs cannot open a new PPF account. Existing accounts held before attaining NRI status can be continued under special conditions.
